patient_records.chief_complaint: Chest pain and shortness of breath for 3 hours
patient_records.history_present_illness: 67-year-old male presents with sudden onset chest pain described as crushing, substernal, radiating to left arm. Associated with diaphoresis, nausea, and shortness of breath. Pain began while watching television and has been constant for 3 hours. No relief with rest.

physical_examination.general: Diaphoretic, anxious-appearing male in mild distress
physical_examination.cardiovascular: Tachycardic, regular rhythm, no murmurs, S3 gallop present

diagnostic_tests.ecg: ST-elevation in leads V2-V6, Q waves in V3-V4
diagnostic_tests.echocardiogram: Ejection fraction 35%, anterior wall motion abnormality

patient_records.diagnosis: ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI), acute heart failure
patient_records.prognosis: Guarded due to significant LV dysfunction, requires aggressive medical management and cardiac rehabilitation

patient_records.chief_complaint: Increased thirst, frequent urination, and fatigue for 6 weeks
patient_records.history_present_illness: 45-year-old female reports progressive polyuria, polydipsia, and fatigue over past 6 weeks. Drinking 4-5 liters water daily, urinating every 1-2 hours including nocturia 3-4 times per night. Also reports 15-pound unintentional weight loss and blurred vision.
past_medical_history: Family history of type 2 diabetes (mother, maternal grandmother)

physical_examination.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs

diagnostic_tests.lipid_panel: Total cholesterol 245 mg/dL, LDL 158 mg/dL, HDL 38 mg/dL, triglycerides 285 mg/dL

patient_records.diagnosis: Type 2 diabetes mellitus, newly diagnosed with diabetic ketosis
treatment_plan: Ophthalmology referral for diabetic retinopathy screening
patient_records.prognosis: Good with appropriate diabetes management and lifestyle modifications

patient_records.chief_complaint: Progressive shortness of breath and ankle swelling for 3 weeks
patient_records.history_present_illness: 78-year-old female with history of hypertension presents with gradually worsening dyspnea on exertion, progressing from 2 blocks to inability to walk across room. Also reports orthopnea requiring 3 pillows to sleep and bilateral ankle swelling. Denies chest pain but reports palpitations.

social_history.exercise: Previously walked daily, now limited by symptoms

physical_examination.general: Elderly female in mild respiratory distress
physical_examination.cardiovascular: Irregularly irregular rhythm, 2/6 systolic murmur, JVD to 12 cm
physical_examination.abdomen: Soft, mild right upper quadrant tenderness, hepatomegaly

diagnostic_tests.chest_xray: Cardiomegaly, bilateral pleural effusions, pulmonary edema
diagnostic_tests.echocardiogram: Ejection fraction 25%, severe LV dysfunction, moderate mitral regurgitation

patient_records.diagnosis: Acute decompensated heart failure, chronic systolic heart failure, atrial fibrillation with RVR
patient_records.prognosis: Guarded due to advanced heart failure, requires close monitoring and possible advanced therapies
